> **Note:** The following parent task has already been completed. This context is provided to help you understand the background and requirements for this sub-task. Do not re-implement the parent task - focus only on the new sub-task described below.

### Layout liquid glass 2026

**Description:** Transform Project Layout to Apple Liquid Glass 2026 Design System

Redesign the entire project interface to match Apple's Liquid Glass 2026 design language, implementing the dynamic material system introduced at WWDC 2025 and deployed across iOS 26, iPadOS 26, macOS Tahoe 26, watchOS 26, and tvOS 26.

Core Design Principles to Implement:

HIERARCHY
- Replace solid UI blocks with floating glass layers that sit above content
- Ensure content always takes visual priority over interface controls
- Implement translucent controls that visually recede when not in active use
- Create clear depth separation between navigation, content, and interactive elements

HARMONY
- Align all UI elements with Apple's rounded geometry standards
- Design for HDR displays and edge-to-edge screen layouts
- Match hardware aesthetics (device corners, button radiuses, border treatments)
- Ensure visual consistency with reference images provided

CONSISTENCY
- Apply unified design patterns across all project screens and components
- Use identical control behaviors and navigation patterns throughout
- Implement shared material physics for all glass elements
- Maintain consistent spacing, typography, and color treatment

Technical Implementation Requirements:

GLASS MATERIAL SYSTEM
- Implement translucency with variable opacity (20%-80% based on context)
- Add real-time GPU rendering for refraction and blur effects
- Create lensing effects where background content subtly bends through glass layers
- Add specular highlights that respond to device motion and user interaction
- Ensure automatic adaptation between Light Mode and Dark Mode

UI COMPONENTS TO REDESIGN
- Buttons and toggles with glass backing
- Sliders and controls with translucent treatment
- Navigation bars and tab bars that collapse/expand on scroll
- Modal sheets with frosted glass backdrop
- Widgets with transparent or semi-transparent backgrounds
- Dock elements with refractive properties
- Control panels with clear separation from content

LAYOUT CHARACTERISTICS
- Rounded geometry matching device hardware
- Selective blur that preserves clarity without flattening depth
- Layered spatial hierarchy with clear z-axis positioning
- Motion responsiveness tied to user interactions
- Text always on solid layers (never directly on glass) for readability

PLATFORM-SPECIFIC FEATURES
- Transparent/adaptive dock and app icons
- Frosted control center buttons
- Optional "Clear Mode" with fully transparent UI elements
- Refractive sidebars that preserve surrounding context
- Glass-based window chrome and navigation elements

Performance & Accessibility Considerations:

PERFORMANCE
- Optimize GPU rendering to avoid battery drain (target <1% impact)
- Implement fallbacks for older devices with simplified rendering
- Avoid nested glass layers that increase processing load
- Limit glass effects in scrollable lists to maintain frame rate

ACCESSIBILITY
- Test against "Reduce Transparency" system setting and provide solid fallbacks
- Respect "Reduce Motion" preferences by disabling motion-based effects
- Ensure sufficient contrast ratios on all backgrounds (WCAG AA minimum)
- Verify readability across various content types and lighting conditions
- Test with VoiceOver and other assistive technologies

VISUAL REFERENCES
- Analyze provided reference images for exact glass opacity levels
- Match blur intensity, refraction depth, and highlight positioning
- Replicate layer stacking order and spatial relationships
- Ensure color tinting matches examples in both light and dark modes

BEST PRACTICE EXAMPLES TO FOLLOW
- Camera app: Floating minimal controls over full-screen content
- Photos app: Disappearing navigation that reveals on scroll
- Safari: Glass address bar with adaptive content-based tinting
- Music app: Layered controls over album artwork
- Weather app: Glass buttons over dynamic/animated backgrounds

Success Criteria:
- Visual parity with Apple's native iOS 26/macOS Tahoe 26 applications
- Matches reference images provided for layout, spacing, and material treatment
- Passes accessibility audits with proper fallbacks enabled
- Maintains 60fps performance during scrolling and transitions
- Works seamlessly in both light and dark appearance modes
- All text remains legible on all backgrounds
- Interactive elements provide clear visual feedback
- Design feels cohesive, premium, and unmistakably aligned with Apple's 2026 design direction

---

Based on my analysis of the codebase and the documentation files, I can now generate the specification. The parent task was about implementing Apple's Liquid Glass 2026 design system, and looking at the `LIQUID_GLASS_GLOBAL_UPDATE.md` documentation, I can see that there are several components still pending the Liquid Glass upgrade:

---

# Specification: Complete Apple Liquid Glass 2026 Implementation - Remaining Components

## 1. **Problem**
The WellWave application has partially implemented the Apple Liquid Glass iOS 26 design system (~70% coverage). Several important components remain without the full Liquid Glass treatment, creating visual inconsistency across the application. Users experience a fragmented UI where some sections look modern (iOS 26 style) while others appear dated.

## 2. **Solution**
Apply the complete Liquid Glass iOS 26 design system (rim-light, inner-glow, noise-grain, glass-pill classes) to all remaining components: Auth forms (login, register, forgot-password), Admin components, and ensure all modals/pages follow the same design language.

## 3. **Acceptance Criteria**

- **GIVEN** a user on the login page, **WHEN** viewing the form, **THEN** all inputs, buttons and error states display with iOS 26 Liquid Glass effects (rim-light, glass materials)

- **GIVEN** a user on the register page, **WHEN** interacting with form fields, **THEN** all elements have consistent glass-pill styling with backdrop-blur and rim-light effects

- **GIVEN** a user on the forgot-password page, **WHEN** viewing the form and success state, **THEN** all UI elements match the Liquid Glass 2026 design system

- **GIVEN** the auth layout, **WHEN** viewing the glass card container, **THEN** it displays with rim-light-ios26 and inner-glow-ios26 pseudo-elements

- **GIVEN** any admin component (ExtractionReview, GlassUploadZone), **WHEN** rendered, **THEN** all buttons use glass-btn-primary or glass-btn-ghost classes, and cards have proper rim-light treatment

## 4. **Files to Modify**

| File | Purpose | Action |
|------|---------|--------|
| `app/(auth)/layout.tsx` | Auth layout wrapper | modify |
| `components/auth/login-form.tsx` | Login form component | modify |
| `components/auth/register-form.tsx` | Register form component | modify |
| `components/auth/forgot-password-form.tsx` | Forgot password form | modify |
| `components/admin/ExtractionReview.tsx` | Admin extraction review | modify |
| `components/admin/GlassUploadZone.tsx` | Admin file upload zone | modify |
| `app/liquid-glass-utils.css` | Add new utility classes | modify |

## 5. **Implementation Tasks**

```tasks
- [ ] T001: Add rim-light-ios26 and inner-glow-ios26 classes to auth layout glass card | File: app/(auth)/layout.tsx
- [ ] T002: Update login-form.tsx with glass-btn-primary button and glass-pill error states | File: components/auth/login-form.tsx
- [ ] T003: Update register-form.tsx with glass-btn-primary and glass-pill styling for success state | File: components/auth/register-form.tsx
- [ ] T004: Update forgot-password-form.tsx with GlassInput and glass button styling | File: components/auth/forgot-password-form.tsx
- [ ] T005: Add noise-grain class and rim-light treatment to ExtractionReview panels | File: components/admin/ExtractionReview.tsx
- [ ] T006: Ensure GlassUploadZone has complete iOS 26 glass styling on all states | File: components/admin/GlassUploadZone.tsx
- [ ] T007: Add glass-btn-ghost utility class to liquid-glass-utils.css | File: app/liquid-glass-utils.css
```

## 6. **Verification**

1. Run `npm run dev` and navigate to `/login`, `/register`, `/forgot-password`
2. Verify all forms display with:
   - Rim-light effects on glass containers (subtle white glow on borders)
   - Inner glow effects (specular highlight from top)
   - Noise texture background (subtle grain)
   - Buttons with glass-btn-primary gradient
   - Error states with glass-pill styling
3. Test dark mode toggle to ensure proper opacity adjustments
4. Navigate to admin routes and verify ExtractionReview and GlassUploadZone components have consistent styling
5. Check "Reduce Transparency" accessibility setting provides solid fallbacks

---
